assignment.title: Setup Java Environment and Write First Program
assignment.objective: Setup Java environment and write your first program.
expectedCapabilities: Write and run a basic Java program
assignment.submissionInstructions: Submit a screenshot showing your code in an editor and the output in the console.

tasks.title: Write a Simple Java Program
tasks.description: Write a program to print 'Hello, World!' to the console and verify it runs successfully.

steps.title: Download and Install JDK
steps.description: Download the JDK from Oracle's website and install it on your computer following the installation instructions.

steps.title: Configure Environment Variables
steps.description: Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable and update the PATH to include JDK bin directory for Windows/Linux.

steps.title: Write First Java Program
steps.description: Use a text editor or IDE to create a file named HelloWorld.java. Write a simple program to print 'Hello, World!' to the console.
steps.codeExample: public class HelloWorld { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, World!"); } }

checkForUnderstanding.question: What is the JDK used for?
What does the 'Hello, World!' program do?
options: Logs a message in a file

checkForUnderstanding.question: Why is the 'main' method important in Java?
options: It is the entry point of the program
It runs the Java Virtual Machine
checkForUnderstanding.answer: It is the entry point of the program

subsections.title: Brief History of Java
subsections.content: Java was developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems in 1995. It was designed to be platform-independent, allowing developers to write code once and run it anywhere. This characteristic, along with its object-oriented nature, made Java a popular language for building distributed applications.-NEW

subsections.title: Java Programming Environment Setup
subsections.content: To write and run Java programs, you need to install the Java Development Kit (JDK). The JDK includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and development tools that are necessary for developing, debugging, and monitoring Java applications.

quizzes.question: What is needed to write and run Java programs?

subsections.title: First Java Program
subsections.content: Your first Java program is a simple application that prints 'Hello, World!' to the console. This program introduces you to the basic syntax of Java, including classes, the main method, and output statements.
codeExamples: public class HelloWorld { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, World!"); } }
